intro: Scrophularia elbursensis, commonly known as the Elburz scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the Elburz Mountains in Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a tubular shape that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
